body:
@tv42 

Since a few months back, the `vitePlugin` settings are moved into their own `vite.config.js` file in the root of the project directory. See the [up-to-date docs here.](https://kit.svelte.dev/docs/project-structure#project-files-vite-config-js) It looks like you were referring to a past version of the documentation.

Indeed, `vitePlugin` has been moved to `vite.config.js`.

The reference in https://kit.svelte.dev/docs/assets should have been updated, but wasn't. I'm marking this as a documentation issue and we can leave this open until that's fixed.

edit: Maybe not? I'm confused now. @dominikg Can you confirm how this config is supposed to be passed?

I've sent a PR to update the docs: https://github.com/sveltejs/kit/pull/5889

It seems there's also a bug that's been introduced though if you're not able to pass the `vitePlugin` options

Okay, so what's described in https://github.com/sveltejs/vite-plugin-svelte/blob/main/docs/config.md is the intended way for this to work - you pass it directly to the plugin if you're using Vite alone, or you pass it in `viteConfig` in `svelte.config.js` if you're using SvelteKit - but the latter of these is broken (or at least has bad types)?

Passing it in vite config doesn't work as the kit plugin includes vite-plugin-svelte without a way to forward them.

It svelte.config.js it works as documented, the config type in kit might need to be updated to include `vitePlugin`
See https://github.com/sveltejs/kit/issues/5485 about inline options in vite config

issue.title: [/kit][Config] VitePlugin options typed in Config
issue.body:
### Describe the problem

**TL:DR;**

the `vitePlugin` key in `@sveltejs/kit.Config` is a bit difficult to discover if you don't already know to look for it. Adding it as a typed option would help with this.
Also I'm happy to implement & PR this if the team approve of the idea.

**Full detail**

I just spent the last half an hour trying to figure out how to enable the inspector.
I couldn't recall it's name, it wasn't in the docs on https://svelte.dev/ or https://kit.svelte.dev/, all I could remember about it is that Rich demoed it in one of their talks sometime last year, and that it was enabled by a config option *somewhere*.

I managed to find an issue from it's experimental days which gave me the name, but the config was in `vite-plugin-svelte`, no use for my SvelteKit project. A few dozen permutations of `svelte vite inspector sveltekit` in google and I managed to find #7390, and then later #5888 which gave me a clearer example of how to enable the inspector.

This feature isn't too hard to find once you know what to search for, but stumbling upon it by accident is probably never going to happen, meaning if you don't know, you *won't* know.

### Describe the proposed solution

Following on from #5888

Instead of having to use this JSDoc in `svelte.config.js`; 
```js
/** @type {import('@sveltejs/kit').Config & { vitePlugin?: import("@sveltejs/vite-plugin-svelte").PluginOptions}} */
```
then manually add `@sveltejs/vite-plugin-svelte` to `devDependencies` in order for TypeScript to bother finding it (pnpm &/ monorepo only?) we could simply use the default JSDoc and have the `vitePlugin` key be typed internally, much like how `compilerOptions` is typed even though it refers to something other than `@sveltejs/kit`.

I don't see it taking more than;
```diff
+import { PluginOptions } from "@sveltejs/vite-plugin-svelte";
...
export interface Config {
...
+  vitePlugin?: PluginOptions;
   /** Any additional options required by tooling that integrates with Svelte. */
   [key: string]: any;
}
```
(in terms of the `.d.ts` output, internally I assume it would be somewhat different to the above)

This way `ctrl+space` in VSCode will show this as one of six (four if you've used `create-svelte`) possible keys at the base of the config object, making discovering the inspector & other `vite-plugin-svelte` features significantly easier.

### Alternatives considered

**Changing the default JSDoc in `svelte.config.js` for `create-svelte`**

The main problem with the JSDoc to type the `vitePlugin` key is that it's pretty ugly, expecially for a config file. And if by default we're suggesting that the `vitePlugin` key should have a specific type, then... give it the specific type.
This also wouldn't effect existing projects who are updating their dependencies, meaning any project created before this change would never know until a developer begins work on a new project (or reads this in the patch notes).

**Do nothing**

Sure, but we're left with the issue; `vite-plugin-svelte`'s features and functionality are near impossible to discover for users who quite reasonably assume `create-svelte` and the Svelte/SvelteKit docs will give them everything they need to build.
I try to keep up with the ecosystem, but it still took me half an hour to figure this out. I don't think that was entirely my own fault.

### Importance

would make my life easier

### Additional Information

```diff
Importance:
-would make my life easier
+would've made my life easier
```
This change probably won't benefit me, but it could benefit others like me, as well as everyone who knows less about `vite-plugin-svelte` than I do (it's not a high bar, but it's a bar) who would find it's configurable features useful.

**Is this a breaking change?**

If someone out there is using `vitePlugin` as the config key for their interoperating tools, then they may have to update their types, or even switch over to a different key entirely.
However, they are already incompatible with the base SvelteKit library, and conflicting namespaces with a core part of the system you're hooking into is a brave idea.

Technically, yeah this could break some stuff. Realistically, there's probably nobody doing that, and if there are it's unfortunately kinda their fault.

---

*I'm happy to get this working & send a PR if the team are happy for this to exist*
